property.description: A control to be used for object properties of the current document that are supposed to contain the name of an attachment from the current (or target) document. Allows uploading new attachments, and deleting attachments from the target document. If no target document is specified, the current document will be used. Object properties are only saved to the current document.
The full name of the document holding the XClass that contains the property associated with this picker.
The name of the property associated with the picker.

The identifier (number) of the object for which the property is displayed by this picker. If missing, the first instance of the class given by the parameter classname found in the document will be considered.
A CSS class for the element surrounding the property value.

States how the property is updated. Accepted values: "form" (default) meaning that the selected value is stored in an input that will be saved via an external form; "direct" meas that the picker is responsible with updating the property value.
Text of the button that triggers the picker. Defaults to $services.localization.render('xe.attachmentSelector.selectFile').
What attachment is displayed in view mode if the property is empty. Should either be empty or in the form of a wiki attachment reference (e.g. "attachment.txt", "Another.Document@attachment.txt").
Comma separated list of file extensions accepted by the property (to become a comma separated list of mimetypes when XWiki will use HTML5). All files are accepted if this parameter is empty.
States whether images are displayed or just their name is printed like for other attachments. Possible values: true, false (default).
The width of the displayed image, only taken into account if displayImage=true.
The height of the displayed image, only taken into account if displayImage=true
The alternate text of the displayed image, only taken into account if displayImage=true
States whether a link to the attachment is associated in view mode with the displayed attachment name/image. Possible values: true, false (default).
The target document name to save/list attachments from

Whether to allow the user to enter a version summary that will be recorded in the history. An automatic message is used when no version summary is provided or if the version summary input is not displayed.
